fields.content: Registration will open August 1st. You can find out more about our fee structure on our [payment policy page](/payment).

Dear Model United Nations enthusiasts, 

It is my pleasure to invite you to join us at the 24th annual McGill Model United Nations Assembly, held this January 24th to 27th in the vibrant city center of Montreal, Canada. 

You may know McMUN as Canada’s largest and most prestigious Model UN conference, the 3rd largest in North American and one of the most competitive and reputable conferences on the globe. However, McMUN is truly recognized for its success in balancing the traditional academic merits of MUN whilst staying true to the changing realities of the international system. McMUN has and will continue to be at the forefront of committee-based innovation with previous successes including the entirely online and personality based World Economic Forum, dynamic Triple Joint crisis, an ever-changing Ad-Hoc tackling WII and the Pixar Board of Directors. McMUN 2013’s twenty-six committees have been carefully chosen to tackle a range of topics, sure to challenge even the most experienced delegates in unexpected ways and certain not to disappoint. 

Events like the Leadership Luncheon and the Head-Delegate Cocktail, our budding network of global MUN conferences and the Delegation Scholarship program demonstrate McMUN’s commitment to fostering a global Model UN community. However, we need your help in making this dream a reality. The more international relations clubs, the more schools and the more countries that attend, the larger this global community, the ideal embodiment of the UN spirit, can grow.   

Despite the snow, we want to make sure our guests have a warm welcome in Montreal. This year’s Friday night Pub Crawl will be a night not to be forgotten, an experience that can only be followed by our famed McParte, a chance for our 1400 delegates and 500 dedicated staff members to celebrate their weekend’s accomplishments. 

Come experience the next chapter in McMUN’s legacy as we expand the horizons of the traditional Model UN mindset and build a global Model UN community. We hope to see you this January! 

Best wishes, 

Mickaela Nixon  
Secretary-General, McMUN 2013
Some short little blurb goes here

Nestled between the slopes of Mont Royal and the bustling downtown life of Montréal, McGill is one of Canada’s premier universities. Founded in 1821 by James McGill, making it the oldest university in Canada, McGill successfully merges rich history with leading edge research. Over 36 thousand students attend McGill from over 150 countries, making McGill the most internationally diverse medical-doctoral university in Canada. McGill has been home to: * the creation of the first artificial cell; * the 1908 Nobel Prize Laureate Ernest Rutherford; * award-winning novelist Hugh MacLennan (1907-1990) a pioneer of Canadian literature; * Henry Mintzberg, current Professor of Management and frequent contributor to both _The New York Times_ and _The Economist_; * two former Canadian Prime Ministers; four justices of the Supreme Court of Canada; former presidents of both Latvia and Egypt and former principal of McGill University and current Governor General of Canada David Johnston; * and Professor of Law John Humphrey (1905-1995), one of the 18-member international committee selected to draft the founding documents to the Universal Declaration of Human Rights and who was Director of the United Nations Human Rights Division for over 20 years. Learn more at [www.mcgill.ca](http://www.mcgill.ca/). ## Student life A strong history of student activism and involvement pervades student life. Student run programming by TVMcGill and the numerous student-run newspapers including the _McGill Daily_ (the oldest student publication in Canada), _Le Delit francais_, _McGill Foreign Affairs Review_ and the internationally renowned _McGill Law Journal_ are a few examples of student-driven endeavors on campus. Numerous NGOs also operate on campus, including UNICEF McGill, End Poverty Now and McMUN's parent organization (the International Relations Students' Association of McGill), which has consultative status within the United Nations' ECOSOC and UNESCO. Learn more at [ssmu.mcgill.ca](http://ssmu.mcgill.ca/).

![Photograph of Montreal taken from the top of Mont Royal.](/static/img/aboutmontreal.jpg)

From its cultural sights, to its museums to satisfy any interest, its lively local music scene to its boisterous nightlife, Montreal has an eclectic and unique character that truly has something for everyone.

No matter the season, time or weather, there is always something going on in the streets of Montreal, be it the Grand Prix, the internationally acclaimed Montreal Jazz Festival, Igloofest, the Comedy Festival, or Osheaga to name only a handful of Montreal’s renowned festivals.   

Famous for its fine cuisine, Montreal offers gastronomical delights to suit any budget. From the vegetarian heaven that is Lola Rosa, to the famed Schwartz’s smoked meat sandwiches, from Portuguese barbeque to over thirty varieties of poutine available 24/7 at La Banquise, you’ll find authentic cuisine of every variety to satisfy your taste buds.  

Often described as a Parisian New York, Montreal is the perfect combination of classic European and modern metropolis. In 2006, Montreal was officially designated a UNESCO City of Design, honouring  its cultural diversity with strong entrepreneurial and creative potential, as well as a flourishing contemporary art, fashion, architecture, music and design scene. However, you will quickly forget you are in North America as you stroll down the romantic cobblestone streets of the historic Old Port.

Crescent, St. Laurent and the Latin Quarter, a few of Montreal’s most notorious streets, all lined with vivacious clubs, pubs, microbreweries and 5-star dance floors. Montreal's nightlife is certain to test the endurance of even the most experienced enthusiasts. And on weekends, events like the Tam-tams and Piknic Electronik, each minutes away from downtown, cater to a more relaxed clientele. 

We welcome you to the city of Montreal, the city with something for everyone, all year-round. We invite you to challenge yourself to have the most exhilarating, enjoyable and ecstatic weekend of your life… but get to committee session on time!
Needs some sort of introductory letter thing about committees. A short one, maybe mentioning the theme and highlighting some cool committees etc

McMUN is proud to be held, once again, at **Le Centre Sheraton**, conference center and hotel. 
We strongly encourage attendees to take advantage of the discounted rates the Sheraton offers to delegates, ensuring all affordable, comfortable and stress-free accommodation in Montreal during the conference.

Located in the heart of downtown, the Sheraton is perfectly situated, with access to Old Port, the Montreal Casino, the Bell Center, shopping, fantastic dining and an endless supply of Montreal’s infamous nightlife.

** insert Google Map with stars over important things in proximity like Bell Center, Crescent Street, Museum of Fine Arts, McGill**

Make sure to book your hotel room before **December 21, 2012** in order to benefit from the following reduced rates:

Single/Double Occupancy
:	$184 CAN

Triple Occupancy
:	$190 CAN

Quadruple Occupancy
:	$196 CAN

* Prices do not include relevant taxes and are subject to change without notification.
* All above prices are quoted in Canadian dollars. Payment in USD can be arranged through Le Centre Sheraton.

Website: [Le Centre Sheraton](http://www.sheratoncentremontreal.com/)

## Features

Here are some of the many features that Le Centre Sheraton will offer you during your stay:

* Elegantly appointed and spacious guest rooms
* LCD TVs with in-room movies and video games
* Wireless high-speed internet access
* Complimentary access to the health club which includes: indoor pool, whirlpool, sauna, fitness center, outside terrace
* Stop for the airport shuttle
* Indoor parking at CDN $20/day
* Extremely close to lots of fast food and quality restaurants
* Elegant conference rooms

We hope that you will enjoy your stay.

* Register online
* Make your deposit; via paypal or cheque
* Register online for Pub-Crawl to guarantee your delegation’s spot
* Send the remainder of your registration fee by December 1st 
* Receive your country assignments
* Submit your delegate badge list online
* Write and submit your position paper
* Have a blast at McMUN 2013!

For some important dates, see the [deadlines page](/deadlines).

As part of our goal to facilitate the creation of a Global Model UN Network, McMUN is proud to offer Delegation Scholarships. This scholarship is provided with the hope of alleviating some of the costs faced by delegations attending McMUN, and is now offered to delegations originating in Canada, the United States, and internationally. 

Please note that this scholarship application is due by November 1st, 2012. 

[Apply here](/ "WTF????")

The number and total value of scholarships awarded each year varies. Please direct any questions to our Charge d’Affaires, Daniel Stysis, at [charge@mcmun.org](mailto:charge@mcmun.org).

List of sponsors

## Travel

[![Star alliance ad](/static/img/travelad.gif)](http://www.staralliance.com/en/business-solutions/conventions-plus/delegates/)

[Star alliance]() is the official airline network for McMUN 2013. You can also book up to McMUN 2015, etc. What else should go here? Need the convention code, and a prominent link to the booking page on their site. Maybe their logo as well. Also more information about booking (discounts, terms and conditions, etc).

August 1st
:	International delegation registration opens
:	Tour de Montreal registration opens (pre-conference tour)
:	Delegation scholarship application opens online

September 1st:
:	Priority North American registration opens (till Sept 30)
:	Pub-Crawl registration opens (guaranteed spot) 
:	Merchandise sales open
			
October 1st
:	Regular North American registration opens (till Nov 18)

November 1st
:	Application-based committees deadline (online)
:	Delegation scholarship application deadline (online) 

November 18th 
:	Regular registration closes, waitlist opens
:	Tour de Montreal registration deadline
:	Registration for guaranteed spot at Pub-Crawl closes

December 1st
:	Remainder payment deadline 

December 10th
:	Country assignments released (subject to payment status)

December 21st
:	Hotel booking deadline 

January 1st
:	Star Alliance discount deadline 
:	Refund request deadline

January 12th
:	Submission of delegate badge list deadline (online)

January 18th
:	Position paper submission deadline

January 24-27
:	McMUN 2013
